p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle for the County of King.
In the matter of the applicatio of Mary Ellen Lyts for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Thomas Burke, Chief Justice of said District Court:
Now comes W. D. Lyts, the defendant in the writ granted herein, and for return thereto respectfully submits to your honor:
That he is the father of said Francis Walter Lyts
That the said Francis Walter Lyts is five years of age
That Mary Ellen Lyts the mother of said Francis Walter Lyts is not a fit person to be given the care custody and education of said child
That the said Mary Ellen Lyts has not sufficient means to support maintain and educate the sasid Francis Walter Lyts

That on or about the first day of June 1888 the said Mary Ellen Lyts has abandoned
and deserted this defendant and refuses to return to the said defendant andand took said child with her hereby refuses to all of defendant to visit such child and is now notoriously living in the home and house of one Fred Brooks

That the said Francis Walter Lyts is not restrained of his liberty, but is detained by the said W. D. Lyts for the purpose of securing to the said Francis Walter Lyts proper protection, maintenance, support and education
